means: 尼克（男子名， Nicholas 的昵称）
[男子名] 尼克 Nicholas,Nicodemus等的昵称

word_mean: 双链核酸分子中一条链上出现的断裂或切割部位。

sentence.Network_en: She sipped the wine. Everything was hazy now, except for Nick's face.
sentence.Network_cn: 她小口地抿着酒。现在一切都变得模糊起来，除了尼克的脸。

sentence.Network_en: News of interest cuts came in the nick of time for borrowers.
sentence.Network_cn: 对借款人来说，减息的消息来得正是时候。

sentence.Network_en: Davey sat as if hypnotized by the sound of Nick's voice.
sentence.Network_cn: 戴维坐在那里，好像被尼克的声音迷住了似的。

lj.lj_ly: you've kept the car &B{in good nick}.

jx.jx_en_mean: Just at the critical moment; just in time.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: of unknown origin
late 19th cent.: probably a figurative use of the verbnick in the sense 'to steal'

entry.def: If someone nicks something, they steal it.

example.ex: He smashed a window to get in and nicked a load of silver cups...
example.tran: 他破窗而入，偷走了很多银杯。

example.ex: We used to nick biscuits from the kitchen.
example.tran: 以前我们常到厨房偷饼干吃。

entry.def: If the police nick someone, they arrest them.

example.ex: The police nicked me for carrying an offensive weapon...
example.tran: 警察以携带攻击性武器为由逮捕了我。

example.ex: Keep quiet or we'll  all get nicked.
example.tran: 别出声，要不然我们都会被抓住的。

entry.def: The nick is a prison, or a police station.

example.ex: After several years banged up in the nick, even you might start to go mad.
example.tran: 在监狱关上几年后，就算是你，也可能会变疯的。

entry.def: If you nick something or nick yourself, you accidentally make a small cut in the surface of the object or your skin.

example.ex: When I pulled out of the space, I nicked the rear bumper of the car in front of me...
example.tran: 我把车从车位开出来时，蹭到了前面那辆车的后保险杠。

example.ex: A sharp blade is likely to nick the skin and draw blood...
example.tran: 锋利的刀刃可能会划伤皮肤，导致出血。

entry.def: A nick is a small cut made in the surface of something, usually in someone's skin.

example.ex: The barbed wire had left only the tiniest nick just below my right eye.
example.tran: 带刺铁丝网在我的右眼正下方只留了非常小的划痕。

entry.def: If you are nicked by someone, they cheat you, for example by charging you too much money.

example.ex: College students already are being nicked, but probably don't realize it.
example.tran: 大学生已经上了当，但他们或许还没有意识到。

entry.tran: 处于良好状态/处于糟糕状态
entry.def: Nick is used in expressions such as 'in good nick' or 'in bad nick' to describe the physical condition of someone or something.

example.ex: His ribs were damaged, but other than that he's in good nick...
example.tran: 他的肋骨受了损伤，但除此之外一切都还好。

example.ex: Tom's house is actually in better nick than mine.
example.tran: 说实在的，汤姆家房子的状况比我家的强。

entry.tran: 在事情正好发生的时候;关键时刻
entry.def: If you say that something happens in the nick of time, you are emphasizing that it happens at the last possible moment.

example.ex: Seems we got here just in the nick of time...
example.tran: 看来我们来得正是时候。

example.ex: News of interest cuts came in the nick of time for borrowers.
example.tran: 对借款人来说，减息的消息来得正是时候。

means.word_mean: 1. an impression in a surface (as made by a blow)
3. divide or reset the tail muscles of;

auth_sentence.content: Possibly, though, you will follow Nick Clegg.
auth_sentence.res_content: Possibly, though, you will follow Nick Clegg.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Possibly, though, you will follow Nick Clegg.

auth_sentence.content: But there's people who will nick oil anywhere.
auth_sentence.res_content: But there's people who will nick oil anywhere.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But there's people who will nick oil anywhere.

auth_sentence.content: But owner Nick Jones is having none of it.
auth_sentence.res_content: But owner Nick Jones is having none of it.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But owner Nick Jones is having none of it.

abbreviation.mean_cn: 姓名信息的关联性要点

means.word_mean: 状况良好/不佳；身体健康/不好

sentences.en: When I last saw him he looked in pretty good nick.
sentences.cn: 我上次见到他时，他身体相当不错。

sentences.en: She wants to sell the bike, but she won’t get very much for it because it’s in terrible nick.
sentences.cn: 她想把自行车卖掉，不过可能卖不出好价钱，那车子已经破破烂烂了。

means.word_mean: 在最后一刻；在紧要关头；恰是时候

sentences.en: He got to the railway station in the nick of time.
sentences.cn: 他在最后一刻赶到火车站。

sentences.en: He remembered in the nick of time that his passport was in his coat pocket.
sentences.cn: 在最后关头他想起来护照在外套口袋里。
